sen.j: 一説に、宗綱は八田（常陸国、現在の茨城県下館市八田）を政治基盤としていたといわれる。
sen.e: According to one theory, Hatta (Hitachi Province, present Hatta, Shimodate City, Ibaraki Prefecture) was Munetsuna' poetical base.

sen.j: これは、宗綱自身が八田を称していたことはもとより、諸氏系図で父・宗円が益子の豪族である益子正隆の娘を室としていることや、宗綱自身が常陸国大掾の平棟幹（大掾棟幹）の娘を室としていること、小田氏始祖となる次男の知家も八田を号されていること、嫡男の朝綱の母が八田局と号されていることなどが背景にある。
sen.e: This theory is based on the following several facts; first, Munetsuna himself called him as Hatta; second, in the genealogies of various clans, it is described that his father Soen made the daughter of Masataka MASHIKO, a powerful family in Mashiko his wife; third, Munetsuna himself made the daughter of TAIRA no Mikimune, Daijo (the third rank official of Hitachi Province) his wife; fourth, Tomoie, Munetsuna's second son, also called himself as Hatta; fifth, the mother of Asatsuna, Munetsuna's eldest legitimate son, was called Hatta no Tsubone.

sen.j: この場合、宗円と宗綱は八田の政治基盤を背景に、真岡市の芳賀氏を傘下に加えながら鬼怒川沿いに宇都宮に入り、宇都宮氏の基盤を整えたとされる。
sen.e: It is said that Soen and Munetsuna entered Utsunomiya along with the Kinugawa River and strengthened the base of Utsunomiya clan while adding the Haga clan of Maoka City under their umbrella backed by the political base of Hatta.
